intro: Hieracium filicladium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hieracium filicladium is often found in temperate regions and is sometimes considered an invasive species in certain areas.
